result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald Lamonte Rideout

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gerald Lamonte Rideout not in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Gerald Lamonte Rideout.  Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date. Case adjourned to Br. 1.
Calendar call scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Gerald Lamonte Rideout not in court, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Gerald Lamonte Rideout.  
Attorney Olivia Simmons in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Atty. Wentz has not been able to speak with her client and requests another status date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.
Pretrial Services Status Report 8-4-2022, filed.  rmm
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Gerald Lamonte Rideout not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Attorney Wentz is requesting an additional status date to speak with defendant as she was not aware defendant was in custody. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed.

Case calendared for Status Conference this date.  Court does not have a reporter this morning.  Matter adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-13-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Gerald Lamonte Rideout in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Wentz informed the Court they are in trial posture but requests this matter be set for status with the co-defendant case.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-16-2022, filed.  rmm

Defendant Gerald Lamonte Rideout in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Pretrial conference held.  Co- defendant has a case in this court which is set for pretrial conference on 5/16/22.  Court ordered this matter adjourned to that date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MACY's

Defendant Gerald Lamonte Rideout in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Gerald Lamonte Rideout in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gerald Lamonte Rideout appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Gerald Lamonte Rideout not in court.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/15/22 @ 2:30p
